Text.Value: My hands are still cold so that handshake will have to wait, but in the meantime: thank you!

EditorData.NodeContext: Enthusiastic, glad, very relieved and happy.

Text.Value: I did say that. And I did mean it. And I do suppose that after all you've done for me, I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.
Speak, or die. Again.
Tell me, or this'll be a very short-lived return.
Tell you what: I will answer one question that you may have.

EditorData.NodeContext: He tries his best to be magnanimous.

Text.Value: Now that you're back with us, there's something else I wanted to discuss.
I failed to control it. Instead it infested me.
Quite. And I must say - I'm glad you've taken my plight to heart. I see my trust in you was most excellently placed.
I could hardly leave you there to rot. You'd have blown up and taken me with you.
It makes me dangerous - even in death.
Nothing would give me greater pleasure. What's the subject of the day?
My word, you did it! Ha! Oh, it's good to be alive!

EditorData.NodeContext: Enthusiastic, glad, very relieved and happy.

Text.Value: That's... Well, that's very kind of you. If the roles were reversed I don't know if I'd have your patience.
If it does, bring me back again. You must. For the sake of many.
I am dangerous. Not because I want to be, but because of... an error I made in the past.
I simply want to know what it is you're keeping from me.
You brought me back to life, and for that I'm in your debt, but we're surrounded by danger. It could happen again.
Yes, I was afraid you'd say that.
That said, I assume you have some questions for me.
To the best of my ability.

EditorData.NodeContext: But after being magnanimous he immediately lowers expectations. He’s not actually ready to give proper answers.

Text.Value: I apologise if that sounds thankless. It's just that some secrets simply cannot be revealed.
It's a relief to be back on beautiful Faerûn. The dreariness of the Fugue Plane oppresses one's soul so very quickly.
I've seen the darkness inside of you, remember? I already know.
You told me you trusted me. Here's your chance to prove it.
But a necessary one! Scrolls of True Resurrection don't grow on trees, you know.
It's time for explanations, Gale.
I brought you back to life. A few answers is the least you can spare me.
You know what? It's fine. You will tell me when you're ready.
The darkness inside you, what is it?
You're welcome. And welcome back.
I do trust you. But some things... Some things are kept in the dark for good reason.
Only fair to warn you I've precious few answers to spare.
That makes me dangerous - even in death.
I'd like to point out that if anything, your protocol was a bloody nuisance.
And yet, there's too much a few answers could undo...
Because it was the truth, and the truth is a great motivator.
If I can.

EditorData.NodeContext: But after being magnanimous he immediately lowers expectations. He’s not actually ready to give proper answers.

Text.Value: I will have answers or I will put you in the ground myself.
It is magic  from another time and another place. It is something that is beyond me, yet inside me.
You don't know. Not really. But after all you've done for me, I do suppose I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.
Why did your projection say that many lives depended on your resurrection?
When I told you I need powerful magic to keep my condition under control, I didn't tell you why. Well, here's part of the why:
Actually, never mind. If it makes you this uncomfortable, I won't insist.
There's no knowledge in a glimpse of darkness. My secrets are still my own.
After you.
I think I've already proven I take my secrets to the grave.
I... I suppose that after all you've done for me, I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.
Now, I believe adventure awaits. Or misadventure, perhaps. Shall we?

EditorData.NodeContext: twinkle in his eye at the prospect

Text.Value: I told you how I sought to win the favour of Mystra. I did this by trying to control a form of magic only one wizard ever could.

Synopsis: In this scene, we’ve gone through an elaborate protocol to bring Gale back to life. He’s obviously very glad to live again, but he realises the player will have questions for him, questions he’s not actually ready to answer.
